column4: ok i'm trying to roll back to the 2.6.22-14 kernel to fix a sata/ide driver issue problem with the new kernel, but when i boot from the old kernel, X doesn't start, i get lines in my Xorg.log of (EE) NVIDIA(0): Failed to initialize the NVIDIA graphics device... suggestions?
you might not have the driver in the old kernel modules that xorg is set to use
so i have to use a different xorg.conf? would the upgrade to hardy have wiped the old one, or made a backup?
you have to check that it's using the correct module.
sorry, Ive actually never done an upgrade.
